tutorial.speak:
Welcome to the Assigning Roles tutorial in Chums. This guide will show you how to assign and manage roles for your church staff and volunteers.
To manage roles, navigate to the Settings section in your Chums dashboard.
Click on Roles in the settings menu to see all available roles in your system.
To assign a role to someone, first find the person in the People section.
Click on their name to open their profile, then go to the Roles tab.
Click the Add Role button to assign a new role.
Select the role you want to assign from the dropdown menu.
Some roles may require additional information, such as department or team assignment.
You can set an expiration date for temporary roles if needed.
Click Save to assign the role to the person.
To remove a role, click the three dots next to the role and select Remove.
You can also create new roles by going to Settings and clicking Add Role.
When creating a role, you can set specific permissions and access levels.
Roles can be assigned to multiple people, and people can have multiple roles.
The assigned roles will determine what features and information each person can access in Chums and B1.Church.
